title: "PVP.net kernel stopped working" fix for me.
body: So on my laptop that I haven't updated league in forever, I tried to launch it and it would crash saying what the title shows. I uninstalled league and redownloaded and tried reinstalling. At the end of the installer it'd say "PVP.net kernel stopped working". I tried multiple things like restarting my laptop, reinstalling league, and deleting Microsoft c++ 2005, and turning off my firewall. Nothing worked until I went into the Riot Games folder and launched the "lol.launcher.admin" application. I don't know if it'll work for everyone, but if anyone else is having the problem and nothing riot tells them helps, maybe try this method.

replies.body: This error is usually caused by a security setting blocking the patcher from launching.  Deleting products and files will end up causing you more trouble, and wouldn't recommend doing that.  Instead, go over the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide for the fix.  Let me know if you have any questions.
